head.supplied: October, 19th 1866 ¶ Twofold Bay N.S.W. ¶ ¶ Received the sum of Eight Pounds 5/- (per P O order) for Sawing Carting & expenses in Cutting Wood Slabs for Melbourne Exhibition & shipped per "You Yangs"...

div.p: P67/474, unit 381, VPRS 3991 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

MS is annotated 'No 2' of 74 receipts covering materials supplied from the Botanic Garden for the Intercolonial Exhibition of Australasia, Melbourne, 1866-7, for which M was one of the Commissioners. The correspondent is probably John Marshall Walker, who was a general agent in Twofold Bay at this time, who is likely to have organized the preparation and shipment of the wood samples. October, 19th 1866
Received the sum of Eight Pounds 5/- (per P O order) for Sawing Carting & expenses in Cutting Wood Slabs for Melbourne Exhibition & shipped per "You Yangs".
